fr:mainmatter.fr:p: The Coproduct monad for a set E is given by the data 1 + E \triangleright T where T\ (\text {inl}\ *) := 1, T\ (\text {inr}\ \_) := 0 and: \begin {align*} \iota &:= \text {inl}\ *\\ \sigma \ (\text {inl}\ *)\ f &:= f\ *\\ \sigma \ (\text {inr}\ e)\ f &:= \text {inr}\ e\\ \text {pr}\ * &:= (* , *) \end {align*} This is the unique monad container structure that you can give the container 1 + E \triangleright T [uustalu2017]. This also happens to be a cartesian monad container. \text {pr} is well-defined up to function extensionality by induction on its implicit arguments.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: The Maybe monad can be represented as the monad container 2 \triangleright T where T\ \text {true} := 1, T\ \text {false} := 0 and: \begin {align*} \iota &:= \text {true}\\ \sigma \ \text {true}\ f &:= f\ *\\ \sigma \ \text {false}\ f &:= \text {false}\\ \text {pr}\ * &:= (* , *) \end {align*} This is a special case of the Coproduct monad container.
